intro: Alcantara isabellae, commonly known as the Isabelline Alcantara, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the genus Alcantara within the family Acanthaceae, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with prominent red or orange markings. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
